column4: sweetpi is correct, to be a valid test you need to run the command in a subshell, like "(echo test >&2) 2> /dev/null"
You're welcome.
What are you trying to accomplish?
like: a='abcde' and d='a'
then echo *magic* on $d should give 'abcde'
a='abcde'; d="$a"
I wouldn't call that "double dereferencing", I would call that two assignments, where the second is dereferencing a variable.
i have a scenario like: for i in t a A ; do echo $i "=>" *magic* on $i ; done
Please explain what you are actually trying to accomplish. I have no idea what you mean by "*magic*".
ok, refer to http://paste.ubuntu.com/548656/ line 108 to line 116
Im trying to set audio file metadata tags a tag at a time
oh, the easier way: I want to do this but for variables with any characters values: first='3'; second='first'; echo "$[second]"

That code desperately needs comments, I'm still not completely sure what you're trying to do but I think this page will be usefull to you: http://mywiki.wooledge.org/BashFAQ/006 . Please read an carefully consider the "Obligitory Note" section.
thank you very much for that link. It gave me a second opinion!! cheers
You're welcome.
thats NOT clever
sometimes I had dedicated a partition to /tmp folder and made /etc/defaults/rcS to not delete /tmp files
clever in the context of computer science is often used as an insult rather than praise :)
now if they will be deleted by programs, especially video which costs bandwidth do download it again, then there is a problem
ok, i understand
Kyle___: its-me-again: And anyone else interested in my script to undelete flash's temporary files, http://pastebin.com/LHxGWq7D replace "chrome" with your browser of choice.
Super GRUB2 Disk is only 1.5 meg and the idea is that it allows you to recover your system by letting you actually boot into your installed system, rather than a separate live environment.
